sentence.Network_en: Of all the lazy, indifferent, unbusinesslike attitudes to have!
sentence.Network_cn: 这是多么懒惰、冷漠、不敬业的态度！

sentence.Network_en: Crook liked her well enough, but remained indifferent to her feminine charms.
sentence.Network_cn: 克鲁格还比较喜欢她，只是对她的女性魅力却始终无动于衷。

sentence.Network_en: The steel workers were relatively indifferent to the issue of nationalization.
sentence.Network_cn: 相对而言，钢铁工人对国有化的议题并不太关心。

一切善恶原则都来自于神法。凡是神法所没有规定的，都是“无关紧要的事”（indifferent things）。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'having no partiality for or against'): via Old French from Latin indifferent- 'not making any difference', from in- 'not' + different- 'differing' (see different)

entry.tran: 不感兴趣的;不关心的;冷淡的
entry.def: If you accuse someone of being indifferent to something, you mean that they have a complete lack of interest in it.

example.ex: People have become indifferent to the suffering of others.
example.tran: 人们对别人的痛苦已经变得无动于衷。

example.ex: ...the row over the police's indifferent attitude to the killings.
example.tran: 严厉谴责警方对杀戮无动于衷的态度

entry.tran: (水平或质量)一般的,平庸的，差的
entry.def: If you describe something or someone as indifferent, you mean that their standard or quality is not very good, and often quite bad.

example.ex: She had starred in several very indifferent movies...
example.tran: 她主演过几部表现非常一般的电影。

example.ex: Much of the food we eat is of very poor or indifferent quality.
example.tran: 我们吃的许多食物质量要么很差,要么很一般。

means.word_mean: 1. marked by a lack of interest;

sentences.sentence: "the universe is neither hostile nor friendly; it is simply indifferent"

means.word_mean: 2. showing no care or concern in attitude or action;
3. (usually followed by `to') unwilling or refusing to pay heed;
4. (often followed by `to') lacking importance; not mattering one way or the other;

sentences.sentence: "whether you choose to do it or not is a matter that is quite immaterial (or indifferent)"
"what others think is altogether indifferent to him"

means.word_mean: 5. fairly poor to not very good;
6. having only a limited ability to react chemically; not active;
7. marked by no especial liking or dislike or preference for one thing over another;

sentences.sentence: "indifferent about which book you would give them"
"was indifferent to their acceptance or rejection of her invitation"

means.word_mean: 8. characterized by a lack of partiality;

sentences.sentence: "an unbiased account of her family problems"
"a gifted painter but an indifferent actor"
"her work at the office is passable"

means.word_mean: 10. neither too great nor too little;

sentences.sentence: "a couple of indifferent hills to climb"

auth_sentence.content: A tone which he meant to be icily indifferent.
auth_sentence.res_content: A tone which he meant to be icily indifferent.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: A tone which he meant to be icily indifferent.

auth_sentence.content: It is indifferent to the dream of ever-closer union.
auth_sentence.res_content: It is indifferent to the dream of ever-closer union.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It is indifferent to the dream of ever-closer union.

auth_sentence.content: Emperors had historically been hostile or indifferent to Christianity.
auth_sentence.res_content: Emperors had historically been hostile or indifferent to Christianity.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Emperors had historically been hostile or indifferent to Christianity.

Sentence.sentence: In a study of older people with sisters and brothers, psychologist Debra Gold of the Duke Center for the study of aging and human development found that about 20% said they were hostile or indifferent to ward their sisters and brothers.

means.word_mean: 莫不关心的,不感兴趣的, 冷淡的

sentences.en: His manner was cold and indifferent.
sentences.cn: 他的态度既冷淡又无动于衷。
他是个手艺平平的厨师。

jushi.chinese: 她是个不太高明的老师。
他是个手艺平平的厨师。

jushi.english: We can't remain indifferent in this dispute.
jushi.chinese: 我们在这场争辩中不能保持中立。
